rooms.description: A minimalistic entrance hall with an open layout and floor-to-ceiling windows oriented towards the north to enhance natural light in accordance with Vastu principles. The entry is designed for a welcoming yet secure transition into the space.

The central living area features robust Brutalist elements such as exposed concrete and geometric shapes, enhanced by floor-to-ceiling windows to create a sense of openness. The north-facing entrance accentuates this roomâ€™s exposure to natural light.

An open-plan studio apartment combining kitchen, dining area, and living spaces in a seamless design that reflects Brutalist aesthetics with raw materials, large windows for abundant natural light, and adherence to Vastu by having the entrance facing north.
A two-car garage integrated within the floor plan, designed with durable concrete surfaces and functional layout while maintaining alignment with local building norms.

openings.description: Floor-to-ceiling windows that maximize natural light entry in line with both Brutalist design principles and Vastu considerations.
A secure exterior door entrance facing north for the studio apartment, ensuring adherence to local norms and optimizing environmental benefits as per Vastu.

external_spaces.description: A large garden area surrounding the building, designed with native landscaping that complements the Brutalist aesthetic while offering outdoor space for relaxation and privacy.
